Description of incident: If you received the Deo B. Colburn              scholarship for the 2003-04 academic year, your Social Security number              may have been made public. Hundreds of Social Security numbers of              former students from all over the northern Adirondacks, including              Lake Placid, were released onto the Internet, potentially compromising              those people's credit and financial status. Information included names,              addresses, academic institutions, the amount of money received and              Social Security numbers of the scholarship recipients.
